title: 200+ followers (hard version)
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/2b7b41db9d.af4552e64a.BnEK34.jpg?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Calvin thinks of a 5-digit number. He tells you the product of the digits is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Knowing only that, there are exactly 200 different numbers which Calvin could have thought of."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the sum of all possible values of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Try the easier version at here."}]}]}

title: Octagon in an Octagon
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/tn6qzjPbzs-200octa.png?width=350"}},{"type":"text","text":"
A regular octagon "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ABCDEFGH"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has squares "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ACEG"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BDFH"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" inscribed in it. These squares form a smaller octagon as shown."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let the the area of octagon "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ABCDEFGH"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A_L"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the area of the smaller octagon be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A_S"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then for some integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is square-free,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large \dfrac{A_S}{A_L}=a-\sqrt{b}. "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let the side length of octagon "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ABCDEFGH"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A_L=2x^2 (1+\sqrt2)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\triangle ABH"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Let the length of line "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BH"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" - this is the length of a side of the squares "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ACEG"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BDFH"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Using the cosine rule, we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^2=x^2+x^2-2x^2 \cos135° \Rightarrow y^2= 2x^2(1 + \sqrt2/2)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now let the side length of the smaller octagon be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"z(1+\sqrt2)=y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A_S=2z^2 (1+\sqrt2)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \Rightarrow \dfrac{A_S}{A_L}=\dfrac{2z^2 (1+\sqrt2)}{2x^2 (1+\sqrt2)}=\dfrac{z^2}{x^2}=\dfrac{y^2}{x^2 (1+\sqrt2)^2}=\dfrac{2x^2(1 + \sqrt2/2)}{x^2 (1+\sqrt2)^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\dfrac{2(1 + \sqrt2/2)}{(1+\sqrt2)^2} =\dfrac{2+\sqrt2}{3+2\sqrt2} = 2- \sqrt2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=b=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and the required answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large \color{#20A900}{\boxed{4}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"One can easily prove that the ratio of side of smaller octagon to that of larger octagon is"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\frac{1}{\sqrt2\cos\frac\pi8}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"we know that the ratio of areas of similar regular polygons is equal to the ratio of squares of their respective sides hence"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{A_S}{A_L}=\left(\frac{1}{\sqrt2\cos\frac\pi8}\right)^2=\frac{\sec^2\frac\pi8}{2}=\frac{1+\tan^2\frac\pi8}{2}=\frac{1+(\sqrt2-1)^2}{2}=\frac{4-2\sqrt2}{2}=2-\sqrt2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let x the side of larger octagon, the square side y,    y^2 = x^2(2 +√2),
 Let z the side of smaller  octagon, (1+√2)z = y,   z^2 = y^2/(3 +2√2),
By similarity  AS/AL= z^2 / x^2 = (2 +√2)/ (3 +2√2)  = 2 - √2 = a - √b, a+b=4"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: Kaleidoscope Octagon
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/e4OyUlGdC2-200octa2.png?width=1200"}},{"type":"text","text":"
A regular octagon "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ABCDEFGH"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which shall be named "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", has squares "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ACEG"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BDFH"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" inscribed in it. These squares form a smaller octagon, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has squares inscribed in it in the same manner, and the resulting hexagon formed is named "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This pattern is repeated until infinity."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let the area of octagon "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be denoted by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Given that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A_1=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", for some integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is square-free,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large \sum _{ i=1 }^{ \infty  }{ { A }_{ i } } =\sqrt { a } +b"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hint: 200 follower special (Part 1)."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using the hint, we know that the geometric progression
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A_1,A_2,A_3,..."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
has the ratio "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r= 2-\sqrt2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
Therefore, the sum
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" S=\frac{1}{1-(2-\sqrt2)} =\sqrt2+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=2 , b=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
